00021 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00022 // Put character to US1
00023 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00024 
00025 void us1_putc( int ch )
00026 {
00027     do ; while( ! AT91F_US_TxReady( (AT91PS_USART)AT91C_BASE_US1) );
00028 
00029     AT91F_US_PutChar( (AT91PS_USART)AT91C_BASE_US1, ch );
00030     };
00031

00033 // Put character to void
00034 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 
00036 void null_putc( int ch )
00037 {
00038     };
00039 
00040 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041 // Put character to USB
00042 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 
00044 void usb_putc( int ch )
00045 {
00046     // Note: The implementation is NOT THREAD safe and assumes
00047     // to be used only from single thread (in this case xsvf main task).
00048     //
00049     static struct ATTR_PACKED : public XPI_IMSG_HEADER 
00050     {
00051         uchar data[ 128 ];
00052         } sMsg;
00053 
00054     static volatile size_t dataLen = 0;
00055 
00056     if ( ch != '\n' )
00057     {
00058         sMsg.data[ dataLen++ ] = ch;
00059         }
00060     
00061     if ( ch == '\n' || dataLen >= sizeof( sMsg.data ) )
00062     {
00063         sMsg.magicMSB  = XPI_MSG_MAGIC_MSB;
00064         sMsg.magicLSB  = XPI_MSG_MAGIC_LSB;
00065         sMsg.type      = XPI_IMSG_LOG;
00066         sMsg.subtype   = 0;
00067         sMsg.timeStamp = dTimerTick;
00068         usbOut.Put( &sMsg, sizeof( XPI_IMSG_HEADER) + dataLen, 1000 );
00069         dataLen = 0;
00070         }
00071     };
00072 
00073 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074 //      Main Program Entry Point
00075 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076 
00077 int main( void )
00078 {
00079     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00080     // When using the JTAG debugger the hardware is not always initialised to
00081     // the correct default state.  This line just ensures that this does not
00082     // cause all interrupts to be masked at the start
00083     //
00084     AT91F_AIC_AcknowledgeIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC );
00085 
00086     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00087     // Create tasks
00088     //
00089 
00090     xTaskCreate
00091     ( 
00092         XSVF_Player::MainTask, (const signed portCHAR* const) "XSVF", 
00093         256, NULL, tskIDLE_PRIORITY + 2, &t1 
00094         );
00095 
00096     xTaskCreate
00097     ( 
00098         FPGA_IrqTasklet, (const signed portCHAR* const) "FPGA", 
00099         256, NULL, tskIDLE_PRIORITY + 3, &t2 
00100         );
00101 
00102     xTaskCreate
00103     ( 
00104         XPI::MainTask, (const signed portCHAR* const) "XPI", 
00105         256, NULL, tskIDLE_PRIORITY + 3, &t3 
00106         );
00107 
00108     xTaskCreate
00109     ( 
00110         MainTimer_Task, (const signed portCHAR* const) "LEDT", 
00111         128, NULL, tskIDLE_PRIORITY + 4, &t4 
00112         );
00113 
00114     xTaskCreate
00115     ( 
00116         USBRCVR::MainTask, (const signed portCHAR* const) "USBR", 
00117         256, NULL, tskIDLE_PRIORITY + 5, &t5 
00118         );
00119 
00120     // Initialize transmitter
00121     xTaskCreate
00122     ( 
00123         USBXMTR::MainTask, (const signed portCHAR* const) "USBT", 
00124         192, NULL, tskIDLE_PRIORITY + 6, &t6 
00125         );
00126 
00127     TRACE_INFO( "--------------------------\n" );
00128     TRACE_INFO( "Starting FreeRTOS...\n" );
00129     
00130     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00131     // Start the scheduler.
00132     // NOTE: Tasks run in system mode and the scheduler runs in Supervisor mode.
00133     // The processor MUST be in supervisor mode when vTaskStartScheduler is called.
00134     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135     vTaskStartScheduler ();
00136 
00137     // We should never get here as control is now taken by the scheduler.
00138     //
00139     return 0;
00140     }
00141 
00142 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00143 //  Show FreeRTOS free stack space of the task.
00144 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145 void ShowStackFreeSpace( xTaskHandle task )
00146 {
00147     // Keep this structure synchronized with FreeRTOS's tskTCB
00148     struct TCB
00149     {
00150         volatile portSTACK_TYPE *pxTopOfStack;
00151         xListItem               xGenericListItem;
00152         xListItem               xEventListItem;
00153         unsigned portBASE_TYPE  uxPriority;
00154         portSTACK_TYPE          *pxStack;
00155         signed portCHAR         pcTaskName[ configMAX_TASK_NAME_LEN ];
00156     };
00157 
00158     TCB* pTask = (TCB*)task;
00159     uchar* pucStackByte = (uchar*)pTask->pxStack;
00160     uint usCount = 0;
00161 
00162     while( *pucStackByte == 0xa5 )
00163     {
00164         pucStackByte++;
00165         usCount++;
00166         }
00167 
00168     usCount /= sizeof( portSTACK_TYPE );
00169     
00170     tracef( 2, "Task [%-4s]: Stack %3u\n", pTask->pcTaskName, usCount ); 
00171     }
00172 
00173 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00174 //  Show processor, global heap and task stack space usage
00175 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00176 void sysDumpStatus( void )
00177 {
00178     tracef( 2, "CPU %3d.%d%%, ", cpu_usage / 10, cpu_usage % 10 );
00179     tracef( 2, "Heap %d of %d\n", vPortGetMaxHeap (), configTOTAL_HEAP_SIZE );
00180     
00181     ShowStackFreeSpace( t1 );
00182     ShowStackFreeSpace( t2 );
00183     ShowStackFreeSpace( t3 );
00184     ShowStackFreeSpace( t4 );
00185     ShowStackFreeSpace( t5 );
00186     ShowStackFreeSpace( t6 );
00187     }
